metadata.title: AI-Driven Tools for Coronavirus Outbreak: Need of Active Learning and Cross-Population Train/Test Models on Multitudinal/Multimodal Data

abstract.original_text: The novel coronavirus outbreak, which was identified in late 2019, requires special attention because of its future epidemics and possible global threats. Beside clinical procedures and treatments, since Artificial Intelligence (AI) promises a new paradigm for healthcare, several different AI tools that are built upon Machine Learning (ML) algorithms are employed for analyzing data and decision-making processes. This means that AI-driven tools help identify COVID-19 outbreaks as well as forecast their nature of spread across the globe. However, unlike other healthcare issues, for COVID-19, to detect COVID-19, AIdriven tools are expected to have active learning-based cross-population train/test models that employs multitudinal and multimodal data, which is the primary purpose of the paper.

sentences.segment_text: The novel coronavirus outbreak , which was identified in late 2019 ,
requires special attention because of its future epidemics and possible global threats .
since Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) promises a new paradigm for healthcare ,
several different AI tools that are built upon Machine Learning ( ML ) algorithms are employed for analyzing data and decision-making processes .
This means that AI-driven tools help identify COVID-19 outbreaks as well as forecast their nature of spread across the globe .
AIdriven tools are expected to have active learning-based cross-population train/test models that employs multitudinal and multimodal data ,
which is the primary purpose of the paper .
